wikipedia_page.main:
Lewis Erskine Wyndham 'Tip' Williams (28 November 1900 – 24 April 1974) was a Welsh cricketer.  Williams was a right-handed batsman who bowled right-arm fast-medium.  He was born at Bonvilston, Glamorgan.  He was educated in his early years at the Oratory School.
Williams made his first-class debut for Glamorgan in 1928 against Oxford University.  From 1928 to 1930, he made 4 first-class appearances, with his final first-class appearance for the county coming against Oxford University.  In his 4 first-class matches, he scored 145 runs at a batting average of 24.16, with a single half century high score of 53*.  In the field he also took a single catch  Through his close links to the county club, he was influential in bringing first-class cricket to Cowbridge Cricket Ground.Williams died at St Hilary, Glamorgan on 24 April 1974.

List of Glamorgan County Cricket Club players
response: * Tip Williams (1928–1930) : L. E. W. Williams

A student of the Inner Temple, he was called to the bar in 1887 and practiced as a barrister. Knight died in May 1938 at Tythegston, Glamorgan. His uncle, Francis Stacey, and cousin, Tip Williams, both played first-class cricket.
